thread.title: From dominant to dumbfounded: Kentucky's season is twisting in the wind - CBSSports.com
thread.title_full: From dominant to dumbfounded: Kentucky's season is twisting in the wind - CBSSports.com

author: Matt Norlander
title: From dominant to dumbfounded: Kentucky's season is twisting in the wind - CBSSports.com
text:
10m ago â€¢ 1 min read 
Kentucky has hit some sort of odd slump here, and it's time to start questioning if the Wildcats will be capable of turning things around. 
No. 8 Kentucky's 88-66 loss at No. 24 Florida on Saturday was the third defeat in the last four games for John Calipari's team. The outcome was the worst offensive game Kentucky's had all season and the first time the Wildcats haven't hit 70 points in a game in 2016-17. 
It was also the widest margin of defeat for Kentucky as a top-10-ranked team since 1992. Malik Monk , UK's most needed scorer, had just 11 points. Kentucky was 33 percent from 3-point range, 38 percent from the field and 61 percent from the foul line. 
Kentucky would be on a four-game losing streak, remember, if Monk hadn't hit a late shot at home against Georgia on Tuesday, putting the game into OT. 
More to come on this story and this team shortly.
